content:
I've updated your shoe inventory accordingly.

**Shoe Inventory**

| **Shoe #** | **Type** | **Brand** | **Style** | **Color** | **Size** | **Condition** | **Notable Features** | **Last Maintenance** |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Boots | Clarks | Black leather boots | Black | 9 (maybe 8.5) | Gently used | Comfortable, worn 3 times, purchased on Dec 15th (originally $150, discounted $20 with loyalty coupon) |  |
| 2 | Sneakers | Nike | Old trusty sneakers | White and blue | 7.5 | Worn out | Worn every Friday to work for 10 weeks |  |
| 3 | Sandals | Adidas | Casual sandals | Brown | 8 | Good | Lent to sister, returned on Jan 15th |  |
| 4 | Loafers | Allen Edmonds | Brown loafers | Brown | 9 | Good | Polished on Jan 20th | Jan 20th |

It's great that you're keeping track of when you purchased your shoes and any discounts you received. This can help you keep an eye on your spending habits and make more informed purchasing decisions in the future.

I've added the purchase date and discount information to your black leather boots entry. Let me know if you'd like to add any other details, such as the total cost or where you purchased them.

Remember, your shoe inventory is a personalized tool to help you stay organized and make the most of your shoe collection. Feel free to add or remove columns as needed to suit your needs!
